channel.title: CVE Feed for OpenVPN -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for OpenVPN -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-46850|2023-11-11T00:15:07.076Z -- openvpn -- openvpn%202%20%28community%29
item.description: Use after free in OpenVPN version 2.6.0 to 2.6.6 may lead to undefined behavoir, leaking memory buffers or remote execution when sending network buffers to a remote peer.

item.title: CVE-2023-46849|2023-11-11T00:05:13.487Z -- openvpn -- openvpn%202%20%28community%29
item.description: Using the --fragment option in certain configuration setups OpenVPN version 2.6.0 to 2.6.6 allows an attacker to trigger a divide by zero behaviour which could cause an application crash, leading to a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2023-7245|2024-02-20T11:08:29.089Z -- openvpn -- openvpn%20connect
item.description: The nodejs framework in OpenVPN Connect 3.0 through 3.4.3 (Windows)/3.4.7 (macOS) was not properly configured, which allows a local user to execute arbitrary code within the nodejs process context via the ELECTRON_RUN_AS_NODE environment variable

item.title: CVE-2023-7224|2024-01-08T13:55:20.160Z -- openvpn -- openvpn%20connect
item.description: OpenVPN Connect version 3.0 through 3.4.6 on macOS allows local users to execute code in external third party libraries using the DYLD_INSERT_LIBRARIES environment variable

item.title: CVE-2023-7235|2024-02-21T10:55:15.487Z -- openvpn -- openvpn
item.description: The OpenVPN GUI installer before version 2.6.9 did not set the proper access control restrictions to the installation directory of OpenVPN binaries when using a non-standard installation path, which allows an attacker to replace binaries to run arbitrary executables.

item.title: CVE-2023-6247|2024-06-04T17:17:12.958Z -- openvpn -- openvpn%203%20core%20library
item.description: The PKCS#7 parser in OpenVPN 3 Core Library versions through 3.8.3 did not properly validate the parsed data, which would result in the application crashing.
